{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3319400,"name":"Robert","username":"Robstruct","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/f475e1/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T02:34:38.189Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone! So our robot has an arm driven by two NEO/SparkMAX setups–one for each side running together. I’m trying to use the built in encoders to create “positions” for the arm to be deployed to–e.g., homePosition, scorePosition, etc. Currently, I have the arm being driven by an arm control command and arm subsytem using the left and right triggers on the controller. It works well enough, but I’d like to be able to drive the arm right to a specific position OR have the arm out/in stop at specific points to avoid over rotating the arm and to improve efficiency.

I tried implementing a version of REVs 2024 FRC bot’s armControl code, but the arm subsytem was quite complex and trying to do much more than I need. I’m looking for the cleanest way to do this–thanks!!!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T02:34:38.189Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":606,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":3063.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"Robert","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63915,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Coach"},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/1","custom_user_title":"Lead Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3319417,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T02:45:37.647Z","cooked":"

Can you clarify if you are trying to hold a current position or are trying to set rotation limits?

This is my arm code and it should do the things you want, with necessary modifications.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T02:46:59.675Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":62.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Delmar-Robotics-Engineers-At-MADE/2024-Robot/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Arm.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2024-Robot/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Arm.java at main · Delmar-Robotics-Engineers-At-MADE/2024-Robot · GitHub","clicks":131}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/2","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319426,"name":"Robert","username":"Robstruct","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/f475e1/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T02:56:50.574Z","cooked":"

Thanks for the reply–I’m looking at your code now.

Actually, I’m hoping to do both of those things. I’d like to set rotation limits for the arm while it is used as a ‘blocker’ to deflect our ring shot into the amp–but the arm is also used for climbing on the chain–there I’d like to hold a position if possible…

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T02:56:50.574Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":52.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"Robert","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60512,"username":"four","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63915,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Coach"},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/3","custom_user_title":"Lead Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319522,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T07:47:36.350Z","cooked":"

Obligatory “DO NOT USE SMART MOTION!”.

It’s implementation is fundamentally flawed, and it can’t correct for position error.

Instead for a similar effect, generate a trapezoid profile in WPILib, and send a stream of position setpoints to the Spark Max in regular position mode.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T07:47:36.350Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":56.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/4","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319603,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T14:02:27.811Z","cooked":"

You can absolutely use similar rotation limits to what I did, but do have a manual override that can be used if it would ever exceed those limits, otherwise, the arm will get stuck there.

For climbing on the chain you could maybe use a similar position holding method as everything else, but have a increased feedforward facing down as to keep the robot up. Also remember that you have to stay up 5 seconds after disable so I hope that your gear ration is immense or that you have a brake.

You might want to take a look at this:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Tuning a Vertical Arm Position Controller

In this section, we will tune a simple position controller for a vertical arm. The same tuning principles explained below will work also for almost all position-control scenarios under the load of ...

I hear this about smart motion a lot, however we have found tremendous success using smart motion can you explain further.

The reason why the position error accumulates is that it controls for velocity rather than position

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T15:37:19.344Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":18265,"username":"sk2983","name":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sk2983/{size}/135585_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319665,"name":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","username":"sk2983","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sk2983/{size}/135585_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T15:41:37.929Z","cooked":"

My understanding is that it controls both, position and velocity? where does it say that velocity only and not position.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T15:41:37.929Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":26.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60239,"username":"DataChaos","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/71e660/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18265,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319666,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T15:42:02.413Z","cooked":"

The way they recommend to tune it doesn’t make sense otherwise.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T15:42:02.413Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18265,"username":"sk2983","name":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sk2983/{size}/135585_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/10","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319667,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T15:43:19.178Z","cooked":"

This is straight from REV’s code example

/**
 * REV Smart Motion Guide
 * 
 * The SPARK MAX includes a new control mode, REV Smart Motion which is used to 
 * control the position of the motor, and includes a max velocity and max 
 * acceleration parameter to ensure the motor moves in a smooth and predictable 
 * way. This is done by generating a motion profile on the fly in SPARK MAX and 
 * controlling the velocity of the motor to follow this profile.
 * 
 * Since REV Smart Motion uses the velocity to track a profile, there are only 
 * two steps required to configure this mode:
 *    1) Tune a velocity PID loop for the mechanism
 *    2) Configure the smart motion parameters
...

They’ve stated that it only uses velocity to track a profile, and you have to tune the mechanism for velocity PID in order for this to work correctly.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T15:44:31.261Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":31.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18265,"username":"sk2983","name":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sk2983/{size}/135585_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/11","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319697,"name":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","username":"sk2983","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sk2983/{size}/135585_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T15:58:13.902Z","cooked":"

So your saying when you are at your “set point” the motor will be getting zero velocity, and therefore falls out of range and then applies more velocity to correct and that why you get the accumulated, position error? if this is the case, couldn’t you counter this with a robust PID tune.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T15:58:13.902Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":29.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":456464,"topic_slug":"arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo","display_username":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18265,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/arm-position-control-rev-sparkmax-neo/456464/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3319708,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T16:06:49.961Z","cooked":"

Sure, but you’re still solving the problem in a less than optimal way. And its much easier to induce oscillation this way, as you’ll inevitably add more kP to make it keep its position. And its just more difficult to tune velocity on a position based mechanism.
